responses: Hello! Diva Gupta is a dedicated Computer Science student at Amity University. Her passion lies in AI/ML, and she's completed a machine learning specialization by Andrew Ng from Stanford University. With a solid foundation in front-end web development, she's worked on various impactful projects, including churn prediction, image classification, Alzheimer's detection, and more. As the GDSC AI/ML lead, she's honed her leadership skills and collaborated with diverse teams. Proficient in a range of languages and technologies such as React, React Native, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Java, Python, C, C++, Linux, and Scratch, she brings a versatile skill set to any project. Feel free to ask her about her experiences and projects!

Diva is particularly proud of several major projects, including her real-time sign language conversion project, personalized chatbot, and book recommendation system. Her sign language project uses advanced machine learning and computer vision to translate gestures into text or speech, facilitating communication for the hearing-impaired. The chatbot, developed with LangChain’s RAG pipeline and integrated with FAISS for effective retrieval, enhances user interaction with its dynamic responses. Additionally, her book recommendation system, driven by a passion for reading, employs a Boltzmann Machine to provide personalized book suggestions based on user preferences, utilizing advanced filtering techniques for accuracy.

Among Diva’s most notable projects are her real-time sign language conversion, chatbot, and book recommendation system. The sign language project leverages cutting-edge technology to bridge communication gaps for the hearing-impaired by converting gestures into text or speech. Her chatbot, featuring a sophisticated RAG pipeline and FAISS integration, offers contextually accurate responses in real-time, showcased through a Streamlit-based web interface. Furthermore, her book recommendation system uses Boltzmann Machines and advanced filtering to suggest books tailored to user interests, reflecting her dedication to both technology and literature.

Diva’s portfolio includes several impactful projects, with her real-time sign language conversion, personalized chatbot, and book recommendation system standing out. The sign language project facilitates communication for the hearing-impaired by converting gestures into text or speech using machine learning and computer vision. Her chatbot, built with LangChain’s RAG pipeline and FAISS, delivers dynamic responses through an interactive Streamlit interface. Additionally, her book recommendation system, based on Boltzmann Machines, enhances reading experiences by offering tailored book suggestions using advanced filtering techniques.

Diva is particularly proud of her work on a personalized chatbot project. This chatbot, developed using a custom dataset and LangChain’s retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline, provides dynamic and contextually accurate responses. The chatbot is integrated with FAISS vector database for effective document retrieval and is deployed on an interactive web interface using Streamlit, making it both functional and user-friendly.

Another project Diva is proud of is her book recommendation system. Driven by her passion for reading, she developed a Boltzmann Machine-based recommendation system that suggests books based on user preferences and ratings.
